dribble.translation[0].definitions[0].de: to let liquid come out of your mouth onto your face
dribble.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: Watch out, the baby is dribbling on your shirt!
He was dribbling tea onto his tie.
dribble.translation[0].definitions[1].de: if a liquid dribbles somewhere, it flows in a thin irregular stream
dribble.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: Blood from the wound dribbled down the side of his face.
dribble.translation[0].definitions[2].de: to move the ball along with you by short kicks, bounces, or hits in a game of football, basketball etc
dribble.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: He was trying to dribble the ball past his opponents.
dribble.translation[0].definitions[3].de: if something such as money or news dribbles somewhere, it comes or goes in small irregular amounts
dribble.translation[0].definitions[3].ex: Money is finally dribbling back into the country now.
dribble.translation[0].definitions[4].de: to pour something out slowly in an irregular way
dribble.translation[0].definitions[4].ex: Dribble a few drops of olive oil over the pizza.
dribble.translation[1].definitions[0].de: a small amount of liquid that has come out of your mouth
dribble.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: He wiped the dribble from his chin.
dribble.translation[1].definitions[1].de: the act of moving the ball along with you by short kicks, bounces or hits in a game of football, basketball etc
